intro: Lippia turbinata, commonly known as the turbinated lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties. Lippia turbinata is also used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects.
